author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN LIKELY TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS...
summary: ...ERIN LIKELY TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 11:00 PM AST Tue Aug 12 the center of Erin was located near 16.7, -40.1 with movement W at 20 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1004 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN LIKELY TO BECOME A HURRICANE OVER THE CENTRAL TROPICAL ATLANTIC IN A COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 11:00 PM AST Tue Aug 12 the center of Erin was located near 16.7, -40.1 with movement W at 20 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1004 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Erin (AT5/AL052025)
